abstract: Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr has thrown himself back into his work six weeks after the death of his eldest son, Beau Biden; has not addressed lingering question of whether he will enter 2016 presidential race, but has instead focused on the tasks at hand, including clean energy and foreign policy initiatives.
lead_paragraph: Though Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has thrown himself back into work after the death of Beau Biden, his staff does not plan further than two weeks ahead so he can care for his family.

headline.main: Grieving Joe Biden Focuses on the Job He Has Now, Not the Next One
headline.print_headline: Grieving Biden Focuses on Job He Has Now, Not the Next One

snippet: Though Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has thrown himself back into work after the death of Beau Biden, his staff does not plan further than two weeks ahead so he can care for his family.
